intro: Calceolaria canescens, commonly known as the hairy calceolaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, which are typical of the genus Calceolaria. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers cool, moist conditions. Calceolaria canescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
